name: Main Academic Building
description: The central hub of PUP’s academic and administrative functions.
history: Originally a housing tenement, it was repurposed to accommodate PUP's academic needs as the university evolved from a vocational school to a state university. It now houses classrooms and offices.

name: Ninoy Aquino Library and Learning Resources Center
description: PUP’s main library and learning center.
history: Named after Benigno 'Ninoy' Aquino Jr., the library was inaugurated on September 4, 1991. It supports the academic community with extensive resources and services.

name: Charlie del Rosario Building
history: Named after desaparecido activist Carlos 'Charlie' del Rosario. It honors his memory and houses student groups, publications, and cultural spaces.

name: PUP Lagoon
description: Green space and renovated relaxation area.
history: Reopened in December 2021 as part of campus improvements. Its history connects to PUP’s origin as the Manila Business School in 1904.

name: College of Engineering and Architecture
description: Home of Engineering and Architecture programs.
history: Once the Institute of Technology, it traces back to PUP’s evolution from PSC to PCC to full university status under Presidential Decree 1341.

name: Hasmin Building
description: College of Tourism, Hospitality and Transportation Management.
history: Located along Ramon Magsaysay Blvd, acquired by PUP in 1987. The Graduate School was later relocated nearby.
